The spoils of war is a reward from the Soul Wars Minigame. It can be purchased from Nomad on the Isle of Souls for 30 Zeal Tokens.

Unlike supply crates and some impling jars which cannot be taken to Entrana nor opened there for possibly containing dangerous weapons and armour, the spoils of war can be taken to Entrana. While spoils of war can't be opened on the main island of Entrana, they can be taken through the law rift in the Abyss or mysterious ruins to the Law Altar and opened there, while the former two cannot be.

Drop mechanic[edit | edit source]

Spoils of war uses a special mechanic to determine items obtained. When the crate is opened, a drop will be rolled for until the roll results in a success, as described below:

  • Roll 1/120 for the dragon drop table.
  • If unsuccessful, roll 1/50 for the junk drop table.
  • If unsuccessful, roll 1/10 for the coins drop table.
    • If successful, roll 1/50 for 40,000-60,000 coins.
    • If unsuccessful, there is an equal chance to receive either 2,000-3000 coins or 20,000-30,000 coins.
  • If the roll for the coins drop table was unsuccessful, the standard table is rolled.
  • The aforementioned sequence occurs three times. However, if players successfully rolled one of the three subtables, players cannot roll for them again. For example, if players received a dragon scimitar, they cannot roll the dragon drop table for the remaining rolls.
  • Once the players rolls the entire drop table three times, roll 1/400 for Lil' Creator.

Rewards[edit | edit source]

The following drop rates are provided by Jagex, unless otherwise specified.

The average spoils of war opening is worth 99,292.19.

Dragon equipment[edit | edit source]

There is a 1/120 chance of rolling the dragon drop table. If one of the player's three rolls on the spoils of war loot table rolled the dragon drop table, they cannot roll for it again.[1]

Below lists the effective drop rates.

Item Quantity Rarity Price High Alch
Dragon med helm11/60059,11260,000
Dragon scimitar11/60059,82660,000
Dragon mace11/60029,68030,000
Dragon dagger11/60017,38818,000
Dragon longsword11/60059,33060,000

Junk[edit | edit source]

There is a 1/50 chance of rolling the junk drop table. If one of the player's three rolls on the spoils of war loot table rolled the junk drop table, they cannot roll for it again.

Below lists the effective drop rates.

Item Quantity Rarity Price High Alch
Soul rune11/150153180

Coins[edit | edit source]

There is a 1/10 chance of rolling the coins drop table. If one of the player's three rolls on the spoils of war loot table rolled the coin drop table, they cannot roll for it again.

Below lists the effective drop rates.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
27 January 2021
(update)

The dragon sub-table was added to the spoils' loot table.

20 January 2021
(update)

Spoils of war can no longer be opened in Glarial's Tomb and the arena where players fight Koschei the deathless.

13 January 2021
(update)
  • A "Check" option has been added, which tracks how many players have opened so far.
  • It is no longer possible to open Spoils of War on Entrana.
  • Rebalanced the quantities of certain items in Spoils of War.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 30 April 2021. (Archived from the original on 24 May 2021.) Mod Ash: "Each roll has a 1/120 chance of getting onto the dragon table, and that table has a 1/5 chance of giving the scimitar. After you've hit the dragon table from a crate once, it won't give you more chances of getting to the dragon table."
  2. ↑ Jagex. Mod Curse's Twitter account. 18 February 2021. (Archived from the original on 18 February 2021.) Mod Curse: "The Soul Wars pet rate is 1/400. The roll happens on the crate separately from the loot table."
